content:
You're looking for a more adventurous route to the Grand Canyon, eh? There are a few scenic routes and backroads you can take from Williams to the Grand Canyon that will give you a more off-the-beaten-path experience. Keep in mind that some of these routes may be unpaved, narrow, or have limited services, so be sure to check the road conditions and your vehicle's capabilities before heading out.

**1. Oak Creek Canyon Scenic Byway (Hwy 89A)**

* This route takes you through the stunning Oak Creek Canyon, with its red rock formations and scenic vistas. The road is paved and well-maintained, but it's narrower and more winding than the main highway.

**2. The Old Route 66 (Hwy 180)**

* Take a step back in time and drive on the historic Route 66, which parallels the main highway. This route will take you through the towns of Valle and Tusayan, with their quirky shops and restaurants. The road is paved, but it's narrower and more rustic than the main highway.

**3. Forest Road 305 (FR 305)**

* This unpaved road takes you through the Coconino National Forest and offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. The road is rough in some areas, so a high-clearance vehicle is recommended.

**4. The Babbit Ranch Road (FR 307)**

* This unpaved road takes you through the Babbit Ranch, a historic ranching area, and offers scenic views of the surrounding countryside. The road is rough in some areas, so a high-clearance vehicle is recommended.

**5. The Desert View Drive (Hwy 64)**

* This scenic drive takes you through the Kaibab National Forest and offers stunning views of the Grand Canyon from the Desert View Watchtower. The road is paved and well-maintained.

**Tips and Precautions:**

* Always check the road conditions before heading out, as weather and maintenance can affect the roads.
* Make sure your vehicle is in good condition, with a full tank of gas, and that you have a spare tire and emergency supplies.
* Bring plenty of water, snacks, and sun protection, as services may be limited on these routes.
* Be respectful of private property and wildlife, and follow all traffic laws and regulations.

These scenic routes and backroads will give you a more off-the-beaten-path experience on your way to the Grand Canyon. Enjoy the adventure!
